item.description: There are three places you can find code to learn from and use: The Badge repo The main Espruino site The Puck.js area of the Espruino site Code Main Pre-installed badge code Games Flappy Bird Snake Simple Mario Asteroids Click speed counter T-Rex Misc JS REPL on your badge! Display a Menu Etch-a-sketch

item.title: Broadcast NFC URL
item.description: Challenge 7 Setup NFC and broadcast a different URL to the one built-into your badge. Prove it works using an Android phone.

item.title: Using the prototyping area
item.description: You can add whatever hardware you like to the prototyoing area. It’s where you’ll be connecting extra LEDs, buzzers etc. The pin-out is as follows:

item.title: Broadcast Beacons
item.description: Challenge 8 Broadcast a URL using Eddystone and/or iBeacon and pick it up on your phone (Android for Eddystone, iPhone for iBeacon).

item.title: Use Noble on Laptop
item.description: Challenge 9 Use the Node.js Bluetooth library Noble on your laptop to read the beacon data that you are transmitting from the earlier challenge.

item.title: Use Badge for HID
item.description: Challenge 10 Turn the badge into a HID button for your laptop and use it as a clicker for your talk at NodeConf!

item.title: Connect to BLE Lightbulb
item.description: Challenge 11 See if you can connect the Badge to the BLE Lightbulb on the table in the hacking lounge and change its colours.

item.title: Connect to BLE LED Strip
item.description: Challenge 12 See if you can connect the Badge to the BLE LED Strip on the table in the hacking lounge and change its colours.

item.title: Communicate with another Badge
item.description: Challenge 13 Setup some sort of two way BLE commuication with someone else’s badge. Work as a team.

item.title: Record and Playback Sound
item.description: Challenge 14 Record sound using the “buzzer” and play it back.

item.title: Display an Image
item.description: Challenge 15 Take a PNG. Convert it to the correct format and display it on the badge.

item.title: Create a Web Bluetooth Page
item.description: Challenge 16 Implement Web Bluetooth with the Puck.js library. Make a webpage that got your last tweet from Twitter and then display it on the badge screen.

item.title: Detect a Person with a PIR Sensor
item.description: Challenge 17 Detect person/heat/movement with a PIR sensor.

item.title: Communicate with another Device
item.description: Challenge 18 If you can get your hands on some other BLE device like a Garmin, Fitbit or Milestone, see if you can figure out the protocol.
